sentences.en: "I come on strong sometimes. Don't know why." She was beginning to feel like a bully.
sentences.cn: “我有时言行很过分，不知道为什么。”她开始感觉自己像个恶霸。

sentences.en: A bully is always a coward.

sentences.cn: 恃强凌弱者往往是懦夫。

sentences.en: He could alternately bully and charm people.
sentences.cn: 他一会儿欺负人一会儿取悦人。

sentences.en: He has been variously described as a hero, a genius and a bully.
sentences.cn: 他被描述为英雄、天才、恶霸，不一而足。

sentences.en: He is a hothead and a bully just like his dad.
sentences.cn: 他和他爸爸一样都是个恃强凌弱的莽夫。

sentences.en: He was a bully. He tried to frighten people into doing what he wanted.
sentences.cn: 他恃强欺弱，总是想吓得人们按他的意愿做事。

sentences.en: He was branded an unfeeling bully.
I fell victim to the office bully.
sentences.cn: 我成了这个办公室霸王欺侮的对象。

sentences.en: I wasn't going to let him bully me.
Some people accuse the tax inspectors of bully-boy tactics.
sentences.cn: 有些人指控税务稽查员使用了流氓手段。

sentences.en: The aggression of a bully leaves people feeling hurt, angry and impotent.
sentences.cn: 暴徒的侵犯令人们感到痛心、愤怒却又无能为力。

sentences.en: The attackers were said to be taking revenge on the 14-year-old, claiming he was a school bully.
sentences.cn: 据说，这些攻击者是在报复这个14岁的孩子，说他是学校的小霸王。

sentences.en: The boy gave the bully a pelt on the back with a pebble.
sentences.cn: 那男孩用石子掷击小流氓的背脊.

sentences.en: The group have frequently used bully-boy tactics.
The smaller boys badly wanted to give the bully a dose of his own medicine.
sentences.cn: 那些小男孩巴不得让那些欺负人的坏蛋也尝点苦头.

sentences.en: We think an attempt to bully them into submission would be counterproductive.
sentences.cn: 我们认为试图迫使他们屈服会适得其反。

trans.tran_en: someone who uses their strength or power to frighten or hurt someone who is weaker
to put pressure on someone in order to make them do what you want
to threaten to hurt someone or frighten them, especially someone smaller or weaker
